project.name: n-orm core
project.description: n-orm is neither an object-database mapping, nor it addresses specifically relational databases. Its name was chosen as a reference to the No-SQL movement. The main goal of the project is to offer a simple persistence layer for Java objects, especially the business model. To keep it simple, it is not possible to use any Java business model, nor any legacy database. n-orm is more a Java view on a column-oriented database, which means that the business model (i.e. Java classes) has to be written according to certain (simple) constraints. Different data stores are possible, especially column-oriented data stores such as HBase, Cassandra or Google BigTable.
